event.title: was known as Dodgetown as early as 1760

data.event: The first non-native settlement in the area was known as Dodgetown as early as 1760.
Lee was incorporated in 1777 from parts of Great Barrington and Washington.

event.title: autumn of 1786 during Shays' Rebellion, about 250 followers of Daniel Shays encountered

data.event: In the autumn of 1786 during Shays' Rebellion, about 250 followers of Daniel Shays encountered state troops commanded by General John Paterson near East Lee.

event.title: 1827, the Columbia Mill in central Lee was established

data.event: In 1827, the Columbia Mill in central Lee was established, and would eventually be the first to supply 100% groundwood newsprint to The New York Times.
The mills previously owned by Smith Paper Company were closed in 2008.
